    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        To be used to securely kill the connection upon process termination.

      • getIDsWhere

        public int[] getIDsWhere(java.lang.String col,
                java.lang.String arg)
        Returns an array of global_ids filtered by a given column matching a value.

        Valid columns to query are limited to:

        • application - the application label as defined by the sensor's owner
        • measures - the physical attribute measured by the sensor. Examples include DISTANCE, TEMPERATURE, LIGHT, and ACCELERATION.
        • unit - the unit of the stored readings. Examples include "cm", "kelvin", and "m/s^2"

        Other methods must be used if filtering by a non-text column.
        Parameters:
        col - one of application, measures, or unit
        arg - an argument to filter by
        Returns:
        an array of global IDs as filtered by col with value = arg

      • getIDsWhere

        public int[] getIDsWhere(java.lang.String[] cols,
                java.lang.String[] args)
        Returns an array of global_ids filtered by multiple given columns and values.
        Parameters:
        cols - a String array containing column names - one of application, measures, or unit
        args - an array of string arguments to filter by
        Returns:
        an array of global IDs as filtered by cols with value = respective arg

      • getIDsWhereSince

        public int[] getIDsWhereSince(java.lang.String col,
                     java.lang.String arg,
                     java.util.Date timestamp)
        Returns an array of global_ids filtered by both a column with a value and a timestamp. Any IDs of matching sensors which have sent a reading since the specified timestamp will be returned.
        Parameters:
        col - one of application, measures, or unit
        arg - a value to filter by
        timestamp - returned values will have timestamps greater than this
        Returns:
        an array of global IDs from rows updated since the given timestamp, matching the given properties

      • getIDsWhereSince

        public int[] getIDsWhereSince(java.lang.String[] cols,
                     java.lang.String[] args,
                     java.util.Date timestamp)
        Returns an array of global_ids filtered by a list of columns and values, and a timestamp. Any IDs of matching sensors which have sent a reading since the specified timestamp will be returned.
        Parameters:
        col - a list containing 'application', 'measures', and/or 'unit'
        arg - a list containing respective values to filter by
        timestamp - returned values will have timestamps greater than this
        Returns:
        an array of global IDs from rows updated since the given timestamp, matching the given properties

      • getApplication

        public java.lang.String getApplication(int global_id)
        Returns the arbitrary application label for the given sensor ID. An application label is given as a descriptor by the sensor's operator upon registration, and is neither unique nor constrained. May be null.
        Parameters:
        global_id - a sensor's global, unique identifier
        Returns:
        the sensor's application label, or null if none.

      • getApplicationList

        public java.lang.String[] getApplicationList(int[] ids)
        Returns an array comprised of the application label for each identified sensor. Never null for at least one valid global_id.
        Parameters:
        ids - an array of unique sensor global_ids
        Returns:
        an array with the application label for each identified sensor

      • getMeasures

        public java.lang.String getMeasures(int global_id)
        Returns the 'measures' attribute for a given sensor ID. Never null for a valid global_id. The measures attribute describes a physical property, such as distance, temperature, light intensity, or wind speed.
        Parameters:
        global_id - a sensor's global, unique identifier
        Returns:
        the property measured by the sensor

      • getMeasuresList

        public java.lang.String[] getMeasuresList(int[] ids)
        Returns an array comprised of the measures attribute for each identified sensor. Never null for at least one valid global_id.
        Parameters:
        ids - an array of unique sensor global_ids
        Returns:
        an array with the measures attribute for each identified sensor
        See Also:
        getMeasures(int)

      • getUnit

        public java.lang.String getUnit(int global_id)
        Returns the unit of measurement for the identified sensor. Never null for a vlid global_id.
        Parameters:
        global_id - a sensor's global, unique identifier
        Returns:
        the unit of measurement for the identified sensor

      • getUnitList

        public java.lang.String[] getUnitList(int[] ids)
        Returns an array comprised of the unit of measurement for each identified sensor. Never null for at least one valid global_id.
        Parameters:
        ids - an array of unique sensor IDS (global_ids)
        Returns:
        an array with the unit of measurement for each identified sensor

      • getLat

        public double getLat(int global_id)
        Returns the latitude of the identified sensor as a double to six decimal places. Never null for a valid sensor_id.
        Parameters:
        global_id - a sensor's global, unique identifier
        Returns:
        the sensor's latitude as a double to six decimal places

      • getLatList

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the latitude of each identified sensor as an array of doubles
        See Also:

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition(int global_id)
        Returns the Position of the identified sensor, containing the global_id with its latitude and longitude. Include com.orange.api.util.Position. Never null for a valid global_id.
        Parameters:
        global_id - a sensor's global, unique identifier
        Returns:
        the Position describing the named sensor's location
        See Also:
        Position

        Parameters:
        ids - an array of unique sensor IDs (global_ids)
        Returns:

        See Also:

        Returns:

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getLastTimestamp

        Returns:

      • getLastTimestampList

        public java.util.Date[] getLastTimestampList(int[] ids)

        Parameters:
        ids - an array of unique sensor ID (global_id)
        Returns:
        an array of timestamps for each named sensor's latest reading

      • getDataSince

        public SensorData[] getDataSince(int global_id,
                        java.util.Date time)
        Returns an array of SensorData types, each describing one single reading update sent by the named sensor by both reading and timestamp.
        Parameters:
        global_id - a sensor's global, unique identifier
        time - an earlier date or time from which all reading updates from the named sensor will be retrieved
        Returns:
        an array of SenorData objects describing a distinct timestamp and reading value for the named sensor
        See Also:
        SensorData

      • getDataBetween

        public SensorData[] getDataBetween(int global_id,
                          java.util.Date start,
                          java.util.Date end)
        Returns an array of SensorData types, each describing one single reading update sent by the named sensor by both reading and timestamp.
        Parameters:
        global_id - a sensor's global, unique identifier
        start - the date from which data will be retrieved
        end - the date to which data will be retrieved
        Returns:
        an array of SensorData objects describing a distinct timestamp and reading value for the named sensor.
        See Also:
        SensorData
